publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1121 Iain Smith: Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme—That the Parliament supports Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme which runs until 31 January 2008 in conjunction with Waste Aware Scotland; urges people to help exceed this year’s Scottish target of 10 million recycled Christmas cards by taking their cards to special recycling bins placed in participating WH Smith, Tesco, TK Maxx and M&S stores; encourages people who do not traditionally recycle to participate in the scheme, and notes that funds raised from the scheme will help to save woods and trees and will contribute towards the Woodland Trust’s projects to create new woodland. Supported by: Jim Hume*, Nanette Milne*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Elizabeth Smith*, Karen Gillon*, Kenneth Gibson*, Robert Brown*, Jamie McGrigor*, Liam McArthur*, Mike Rumbles*, David Stewart*, Patrick Harvie*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Bill Wilson*, Marlyn Glen*

S3M-1121 Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 11 January 2008) Elaine Murray*, John Park*, Margaret Mitchell*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Robin Harper*, Ross Finnie*, Mike Pringle*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-1121 Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 11 January 2008) Jamie Hepburn*, Trish Godman*, Alison McInnes*
S3M-1121 Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 11 January 2008) Nicol Stephen*, Ken Macintosh*, Margaret Smith*
S3M-1121 Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 11 January 2008) Jim Tolson*
S3M-1121 Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 11 January 2008) Jamie Stone*
S3M-1121 Woodland Trust Scotland’s Christmas Card Recycling Scheme (lodged on 11 January 2008) Jack McConnell*
